message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS

This paper is primarily focused on the optimization of neural networks, specifically shallow linear neural networks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of regularizers, which is a common technique in optimization and machine learning, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) another likely sub-category. The paper's focus on optimization and convergence also suggests cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as a possible sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions experiments involving image classification, which falls under cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper's discussion of the loss landscape and critical points suggests cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as a possible sub-category.
